name: NFDI4Health_LM_MDS_Design
title: NFDI4Health Module Design
description: NFDI4Health Logical Model of Module Design V3.3.1

element.definition: NFDI4Health Logical Model of Module Design V3.3.1
Group of items relevant for studies, substudies, registries and/or secondary data sources, including details on targeted health conditions, study population, outcome measures, and study design.
element.comment: Additional information: Group of items applicable only to studies, substudies, registries, and secondary data sources.

element.short: Is the study design non-interventional or interventional?
element.definition: Is the study design non-interventional or interventional?
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
*  1..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: Group of items providing information about the study design.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
*  1..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: The strategy for assigning interventions to participants.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 1..*M 1..*, if Design.primaryDesign == "Interventional"
* 0..0, if Design.primaryDesign != "Interventional"

element.definition: The primary strategy for participant identification and follow-up.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 1..*M 1..*, if Design.primaryDesign == "Non-interventional"
* 0..0, if Design.primaryDesign != "Non-interventional"

element.short: Primary health conditions or diseases considered in the [RESOURCE]
element.definition: Group of items providing information about primary health conditions or diseases considered in the [RESOURCE].
The disease, disorder, syndrome, illness, or injury that is being studied. Conditions may also include other health-related issues, such as lifespan, quality of life, and health risks.
element.comment: Additional information: The use of terms from established terminologies/classifications (e.g. SNOMED CT, ICD, etc.) is preferred. However, also self-assigned terms are allowed.

element.definition: Terminology/classification used to specify the health condition or disease.

element.short: Code of the health condition or disease
element.definition: Code of the health condition or disease in the terminology/classification.
Group of items providing information about the focus of the [RESOURCE] (e.g. medication, food, therapy, device, etc.).
Focus area of the [RESOURCE] (e.g. medication, food, therapy, device, etc.).
element.comment: Additional information: The use of terms from established terminologies/classifications (e.g. SNOMED CT, ICD, etc.) is preferred. However, also self-assigned terms are allowed.

element.definition: Terminology/classification used for the focus area.
Code of the focus area in the terminology/classification.
Group of items providing information about groups of diseases or conditions on which the data were collected in the [RESOURCE].

element.short: Which groups of diseases or conditions were the data collected on?
element.definition: General groups of diseases or conditions on which the data were collected.
element.comment: Additional information: The values originate from the WHO's International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, 10th Revision (ICD-10).

element.short: On which diseases or conditions were the data collected?
element.definition: Diseases or conditions on which the data were collected in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: The values originate from the WHO's International Statistical Classification of Diseases and Related Health Problems, 10th Revision (ICD-10).

element.definition: Indication whether mortality data are collected in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if (Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.studyType.nonInterventional == ("Longitudinal" OR "Cohort" OR "Case-cohort" OR "Birth cohort" OR "Trend" OR "Panel")) OR Resource.classification.type == ("Registry" OR
                                    "Secondary data source")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source") AND Design.studyType.nonInterventional != ("Longitudinal" OR "Cohort" OR "Case-cohort" OR "Birth cohort" OR "Trend" OR "Panel")

element.definition: Group of items providing administrative information about the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
*  1..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.short: Status of the ethics committee approval
element.definition: Status of the request for approval from the (leading) ethics committee.
Overall status of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Additional information: If at least one study site in a multicenter study has the status 'Ongoing', then the overall status of the study must be 'Ongoing'. Cardinality: 
*  1..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.short: Is the intervention ongoing or completed?
element.definition: Is the intervention ongoing or completed?
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.primaryDesign == "Interventional" AND Design.administrativeInformation.status == ("At the planning stage" OR "Ongoing (I): Recruitment ongoing, but data collection not yet
                                    started" OR "Ongoing (II): Recruitment and data collection ongoing" OR "Ongoing (III): Recruitment completed, but data collection ongoing" OR "Ongoing (IV): Recruitment and data collection completed, but data quality management ongoing")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.primaryDesign != "Interventional" OR Design.administrativeInformation.status != ("At the planning stage" OR "Ongoing (I): Recruitment ongoing, but data
                                    collection not yet started" OR "Ongoing (II): Recruitment and data collection ongoing" OR "Ongoing (III): Recruitment completed, but data collection ongoing" OR "Ongoing (IV): Recruitment and data collection completed, but data quality management ongoing")

element.definition: Specification of the stage at which the [RESOURCE] was prematurely stopped.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.administrativeInformation.status == ("Suspended: Recruitment, data collection, or data quality management, halted, but potentially will resume" OR "Terminated: Recruitment, data
                                    collection, data and quality management halted prematurely and will not resume")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.administrativeInformation.status != ("Suspended: Recruitment, data collection, or data quality management, halted, but potentially will resume" OR "Terminated:
                                    Recruitment, data collection, data and quality management halted prematurely and will not resume")

element.definition: Specification of the reasons why the [RESOURCE] was prematurely stopped, for example due to toxicity, closed due to lack of study progress, temporarily closed per study design.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.administrativeInformation.status == ("Suspended: Recruitment, data collection, or data quality management, halted, but potentially will resume" OR "Terminated: Recruitment, data
                                    collection, data and quality management halted prematurely and will not resume")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.administrativeInformation.status != ("Suspended: Recruitment, data collection, or data quality management, halted, but potentially will resume" OR "Terminated:
                                    Recruitment, data collection, data and quality management halted prematurely and will not resume")

element.definition: Specification whether participants are selected from a predetermined population.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.short: Overall recruitment status from the register of clinical trials
element.definition: Overall recruitment status of the study as indicated in the corresponding register of clinical trials.
element.comment:
Additional information: The item applies only to studies automatically uploaded from the registers of clinical trials.
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Resource.provenance.dataSource != "Manually collected"
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Resource.provenance.dataSource == "Manually collected"

element.definition: In case of a planned [RESOURCE], enter the intended start date. In case of an ongoing [RESOURCE], enter the actual start date.
element.comment: Additional information: Preferred date format: DD.MM.YYYY.

element.definition:
In case of a planned or ongoing [RESOURCE], enter the intended end date. In case of a completed [RESOURCE], enter the actual end date.
                             
In case of a [RESOURCE] with patients or other participants, it is the date when the last participant is examined or receives an intervention, or the date of the last participant’s last visit.
element.comment: Additional information: Preferred date format: DD.MM.YYYY.

element.definition: Specification whether the data are collected at only one or at more than one study center.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: Number of study centers involved in data collection.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.centers == "Multicentric"
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.centers != "Multicentric"

element.definition: Specification whether the [RESOURCE] involves only one or more than one data provider.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source")

element.definition: Number of data providers involved in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source") AND Design.dataProviders == "Several data providers"
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source") OR Design.dataProviders != "Several data providers"

element.definition: The primary subject addressed by the [RESOURCE], for example persons, animals or other subject types.
Group of items providing information about the applied sampling method.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: Type of the sampling method applied for the selection of participants.
Specific type of the probability sampling method applied for the selection of participants.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Design.sampling.method == "Probability"
* 0..0, if Design.sampling.method != "Probability"

element.definition: Specific type of the non-probability sampling method applied for the selection of participants.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Design.sampling.method == "Non-probability"
* 0..0, if Design.sampling.method != "Non-probability"

element.definition: Group of items providing information about data sources from which the data of the [RESOURCE] are generated or extracted.
Different types of data sources from which the data of the [RESOURCE] are generated or extracted.
Specification of biosamples collected in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Design.dataSource.general == "Biological samples"
* 0..0, if Design.dataSource.general != "Biological samples"

element.definition: Specification of imaging data collected in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Design.dataSource.general == "Imaging data"
* 0..0, if Design.dataSource.general != "Imaging data"

element.definition: Specification of omics technologies applied in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Design.dataSource.general == "Omics technology"
* 0..0, if Design.dataSource.general != "Omics technology"

element.definition: If needed, additional descriptive information about the data sources of the [RESOURCE], for example indication of data sources not listed in the field 'Type(s) of data sources' or a more detailed description of the selected data sources.

Foremost for interventional studies, please specify the primary purpose why the study was conducted. For non-interventional studies, this field may be 'Not applicable' as multiple purposes may be defined as primary ones.
element.comment:
Additional information: The field is defined foremost for interventional studies. For non-interventional studies, this field may not be applicable as diverse purposes may be pursued without being able to specify a primary one. In this case, the option 'Not applicable' can be
                        selected.
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: Group of items providing information about eligibility criteria for participants.
Group of items providing information about the minimum eligible age of participants.
Numerical value of the minimum age of potential participants eligible to participate in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: In the case of cohort studies, further participant ages can be indicated in the fields 'Inclusion criteria' or 'Exclusion criteria'.

element.definition: Unit of measurement used to describe the minimum eligible age.
Group of items providing information about the maximum eligible age of participants.
Numerical value of the maximum age of potential participants eligible to participate in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment: Additional information: In the case of cohort studies, further participant ages can be indicated in the fields 'Inclusion criteria' or 'Exclusion criteria'.

element.definition: **Description: **Unit of measurement used to describe the maximum eligible age.
Gender of potential participants eligible to participate in the [RESOURCE].
Inclusion criteria for participation in the [RESOURCE].

example.label: example
example.valueString: - First inclusion criterion; - Second inclusion criterion;

element.definition: Exclusion criteria for participation in the [RESOURCE].

example.label: example
example.valueString: - First inclusion criterion; - Second inclusion criterion;

element.definition: Group of items providing information about the population of the [RESOURCE].
Specification of the recruitment area of the [RESOURCE].
Country or countries where the [RESOURCE] takes place.
If applicable, regions and/or cities within a country where the [RESOURCE] takes place.
Additional descriptive information providing more details about the population of the [RESOURCE].
Intended number of observational units for the whole [RESOURCE] (for example intended number of participants at all sites).
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: Obtained number of observational units for the whole [RESOURCE] (for example obtained number of participants at all sites).
element.comment: Additional information: The value is only available after the end of recruitment.

element.definition: Statement of the research questions and/or hypotheses underlying the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: Group of items providing information about the arms of the study.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.primaryDesign == "Interventional"
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.primaryDesign != "Interventional"

element.definition: Short name used to identify the arm.
element.comment: Additional information: 'Arm' means a pre-specified group or subgroup of participants in the [RESOURCE] assigned to receive specific intervention(s) (or no intervention) according to a protocol.

element.definition: Role of the given arm in the [RESOURCE].
Additional descriptive information about the given arm.
element.comment: Additional information: If needed, additional descriptive information (including which interventions are administered in each arm) to differentiate each arm from other arms in the [RESOURCE].

element.definition: Group of items providing information about the groups/cohorts of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.primaryDesign == "Non-interventional"
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.primaryDesign != "Non-interventional"

element.definition: Short name used to identify the group.
element.comment: Additional information: 'Group' means a predefined group (cohort) of participants to be studied.

element.definition: Additional descriptive information about the given group.
element.comment: Additional information: Explanation of the nature of the group of participants (for example, participants with and without a condition, participants with and without an exposure, etc.).

element.definition: Group of items providing information about the interventions of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Additional information: Specification of the intervention(s) associated with each arm.
* 0..*, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.primaryDesign == "Interventional"
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.primaryDesign != "Interventional"

element.definition: A short descriptive name of the intervention.
General type of the given intervention.
If needed, additional descriptive information about the given intervention.

element.short: Name(s) of the arm(s) associated with the given intervention
element.definition: Name(s) of the arm(s) of the [RESOURCE] associated with the given intervention.
Group of items providing information about the exposures of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Additional information: Specification of the exposure(s) associated with each group.
* 0..*, if (Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.primaryDesign == "Non-interventional") OR Resource.classification.type == ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source") AND Design.primaryDesign != "Non-interventional"

element.definition: A short descriptive name of the exposure.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
*  1..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: General type of the given exposure.
If needed, additional descriptive information about the given exposure.

element.short: Name(s) of the group(s) associated with the given exposure
element.definition: Name(s) of the group(s) of the [RESOURCE] associated with the given exposure.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: Group of items providing information about outcome measures.
element.comment: Additional information: The items are optional, especially for non-interventional studies.

element.definition:
Name of the outcome measure.
For non-interventional studies, this can be the name of specific measurements or observations used to describe patterns of diseases or traits or associations with exposures, risk factors or treatment.
Additional descriptive information about the given outcome.
The type indicates the degree of importance of the outcome measure in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
*  1..1, if Design.outcomes.title != Null OR Design.outcomes.description != Null
* 0..0, if Design.outcomes.title == Null AND Design.outcomes.description == Null

element.definition: Description of the time point(s) at which the measurement for the outcome is assessed, for example the specific duration of time over which each participant is assessed.
Any additional information about specific aspects of the [RESOURCE] that could not be captured by other fields.
Any additional assessments/measurements included in the [RESOURCE].
Group of items providing information regarding the sharing of data by the [RESOURCE].
Indication whether there is a plan to make data collected in the [RESOURCE] available. In case of a [RESOURCE] with patients or other individuals, this refers to individual participant data (IPD).

element.short: Supporting documents available in addition to the data
element.definition: Supporting information and documents which will be made available in addition to the data collected in the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Design.dataSharingPlan.generally == "Yes, there is a plan to make data available"
* 0..0, if Design.dataSharingPlan.generally != "Yes, there is a plan to make data available"

element.short: When and for how long will the data be available?
element.definition: Indication of the time period for which the data and, if applicable, supporting documents will be made available.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Design.dataSharingPlan.generally == "Yes, there is a plan to make data available"
* 0..0, if Design.dataSharingPlan.generally != "Yes, there is a plan to make data available"

element.definition: Indication of the access criteria by which the data will be shared, including: a) with whom; b) for which types of analyses; and c) by what mechanism.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Design.dataSharingPlan.generally == "Yes, there is a plan to make data available"
* 0..0, if Design.dataSharingPlan.generally != "Yes, there is a plan to make data available"

element.definition: Additional descriptive information providing more details about data sharing, for example indication of which data in particular will be shared or why the data will not be shared or why it is not yet decided.
Indication whether the DataSHIELD/Opal infrastructure is available.
If existing, a link to the web page where the data request form and/or information on data reuse can be found.

element.short: Web page with additional information about data sharing
element.definition: If existing, a link to the web page where additional information about data sharing can be found.
Indication if record linkage with other data sources is possible.
element.comment:
Additional information: Record linkage refers to the merging of data on the same person from different databases.
*  1..1, if Resource.provenance.dataSource == "Manually collected"
* 0..0, if Resource.provenance.dataSource != "Manually collected"

element.definition: Group of items providing information about specific non-interventional aspects of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Additional information: Group of items applicable only to non-interventional resources.
* 0..1, if (Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.primaryDesign == "Non-interventional") OR Resource.classification.type == ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Registry" OR "Secondary data source") AND Design.primaryDesign != "Non-interventional"

element.definition: Temporal design of the study, i.e. the observation period in relation to the time of participant enrollment.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 0..*, if Resource.classification.type == ('Study' OR 'Substudy'); otherwise 0..0
* 0..*, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy")
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy")

element.definition: If applicable, anticipated time period over which each participant would be followed.
Numerical value of the target follow-up duration.
Unit of measurement used to describe the follow-up duration.
The number of follow-ups conducted within the specified duration.
Indication whether samples of biomaterials from participants are retained in a biorepository.
Additional information about retained biosamples, i.e. an indication of the specific types of retained biospecimens (e.g. blood, serum, urine, etc.).
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Design.nonInterventional.biospecimenRetention != "None retained"
* 0..0, if Design.nonInterventional.biospecimenRetention == "None retained"

element.definition: Group of items providing information about specific interventional aspects of the [RESOURCE].
element.comment:
Additional information: Group of items applicable only to interventional resources.
* 0..1, if Resource.classification.type == ("Study" OR "Substudy") AND Design.primaryDesign =="Interventional"
* 0..0, if Resource.classification.type != ("Study" OR "Substudy") OR Design.primaryDesign !="Interventional"

element.definition: If applicable, numerical phase of the [RESOURCE].
Group of items providing information about the masking of intervention(s) assignment.

Indication whether a masking (or blinding) of intervention(s) assignment is implemented (i.e., whether someone is prevented from having knowledge of the interventions assigned to individual participants).
If masking is implemented, the party(ies) who are masked.
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..*, if Design.interventional.masking.general == true
* 0..0, if Design.interventional.masking.general == false

element.definition: If needed, additional descriptive information about masking (e.g. information about other parties who may be masked).
element.comment:
Cardinality: 
* 0..1, if Design.interventional.masking.general == true
* 0..0, if Design.interventional.masking.general == false

element.short: Type of allocation of participants to an arm
element.definition: Type of allocation/assignment of individual participants of the [RESOURCE] to an arm.

element.short: Off-label use of a drug product
element.definition: Unapproved (off-label) use of a drug product.
